subject: Leadership
title: Resource Allocation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Resource Allocation.

hook.text: A company calls innovation its top priority. But 95% of the budget goes to existing products. Words lie. Budgets don't.

buildup.text: Resource allocationâ€”where you put money, people, and timeâ€”is the truest expression of strategy. It reveals priorities.

discovery.text: Christensen argued that strategy is determined by where resources flow, not by what leaders say in meetings.

twist.text: Political dynamics often hijack allocation. Loud voices get resources while quiet, high-potential projects starve.

climax.text: Strategic leaders audit allocation quarterly: does where we spend match where we say we're going? If not, reallocate.

punchline.text: Show me your budget and I'll show you your real strategy.

quiz.question: Why is resource allocation the truest expression of strategy?
options: It reveals real priorities through action
It's decided only by the finance team
